Easing the load on a weary bullpen, the right-hander allowed one run on five hits in 7 2/3 innings Sunday as the Rangers went into the All-Star break on a high note, beating the Astros, 5-1, and winning play-51 Game Recap play-52 Condensed Game Watch Archive carousel-arrow-right-120 Player of the Game Player of the Game Eovaldi 7.2 IP, ER, 8 K, BB +28.7% WPA See Leaderboard arrow-next-4 Top Performers Eovaldi W, 7.2 IP 5 H, 1 ER, 8 SO Carter 2 - 4 3B, 2B, RBI, 2 R Duran, E 2 - 3 2B, BB, RBI Team Comparison R H HR TB SB LOB E Rangers 5 8 2 18 1 5 0 Astros 1 6 1 11 0 4 0 Data Visualizations play-54 The distance behind Adolis García's home run 00:13 play-55 A deep dive into Adolis García's home run 00:11 play-56 Hunter Brown's outing against the Rangers 00:25 play-57 Breaking down Hunter Brown's pitches 00:04 carousel-arrow-right-74 More Coverage Paredes to miss All-Star Game due to family matter How could Rangers make a 2nd-half postseason push?
